column7: ASX purchased a small amount of high-quality Australian carbon credits (2% of total emissions) in FY23. These carbon credits support the Mount Sandy Conservation project in South Australia, which ensures permanent protection for a regionally and culturally essential pocket of biodiversity-rich land in partnership with its Traditional Owners.

column7: ASX reduced total Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions by at least 85% in FY23. This target is based on our FY21 baseline and is a crucial deliverable under ASX's Climate Change Statement launched in FY22.

column7: ASX is embedding an organisation-wide e-waste Policy and associated processes to ensure that all electronic waste is handled ethically, securely, and sustainably by best practice. Selection criteria for vendor-supplied services (where appropriate) are intended to evaluate their company ESG statements to ensure alignment with ASX's sustainability values.

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column7: Approximately 20% of ASX Group's total supplier spend during FY23 was attributed to 27 "Tier 1" suppliers providing essential goods and services to facilitate ASX Group's operations. These suppliers cover a range of industry sectors, including financial services, technology goods and services, telecommunications, and risk management. ASX Group's operations require uninterrupted access to the infrastructure that services our business. Therefore, our core supplier relationships are often stable, long-term relationships rather than short-term ones.

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column7: ASX is proactive in measuring and reducing its environmental footprint to procure products and services with the least possible negative environmental impact.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: ASX supports our people in balancing work and family life. Our Employee Assistance Program offers paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers, superannuation contributions, graduated return to work, childcare assistance, and support and coaching. We are also an accredited Breastfeeding Friendly Workplace.
column20: Work-life balance support, Employee assistance program, Paid parental leave

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: The Group provides performance rights to ordinary shares of the Company to certain Key Management Personnel (KMP) as part of the LTVR Plan to recognise performance, skills and behaviours that deliver sustainable long-term shareholder value. They entitle participants to performance rights over ASX Limited shares. Eligibility is by invitation of the Board and is reviewed annually.
column20: Performance rights under LTVR Plan, Long-term shareholder value, Shareholder recognition

column13: The Group operates a deferred equity plan for Key Management Personnel (KMP) and other employees. Under the plan, an employee receives between 40% and 50% of their short-term variable reward (STVR) in cash, and the remainder is granted as shares, with deferred vesting for 2 or 4 years from the grant date. The shares are forfeited if the employee ceases employment during the restriction period, except in certain circumstances. \t
column20: Deferred equity plan, Short-term variable reward, Employee retention

column13: The ASX Employee Share Purchase Plan offers the opportunity for employees to purchase fully paid ordinary shares in ASX through salary sacrifice up to the value of $1,000 at a discount of 10%. All Australian permanent full-time and part-time employees and maximum-term contractors with end dates beyond 30 June are eligible to participate in the scheme.
column20: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Salary sacrifice, Share discount

column7: We offer paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers

column7: Executive KMP initiated: 6 months, ASX initiated: 12 months, Poor performance: 3 months.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: ASX's Enterprise Risk Management framework is based on the International Standard (ISO 31000) for risk management. Management has established the Enterprise Risk Management Committee and other dedicated risk forums to approve risk policies, monitor framework execution and coordinate general risk matters. Within the framework, and in addition to the daily management of business activities, each business unit must formally profile its risk environment every six months, including identifying key risks, assessing control design and operation, and evaluating key risk indicators.
column20: Enterprise Risk Management framework, ISO 31000, Risk profiling
column24: supplier code of conduct, risk management policies

column13: Making a positive contribution to ASX culture by promoting and facilitating physical and mental wellbeing through employee participation and community connection. 91% of employees believe ASX is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace
column20: Employee wellbeing, Community connection, Safe workplace

column13: As an inclusive organisation, we support formal flexibility arrangements and informal flexibility through our support for hybrid working. We aim to balance our flexible working approach with the needs of our employees, stakeholders, customers, and partners. We use a principles-based approach to guide appropriate flexible working arrangements, recognising that in-person interactions increase our sense of belonging, connection, and alignment.
column20: Flexible working arrangements, Hybrid working, Principles-based approach
